intro: Nemosenecio formosanus, commonly known as the Taiwan nemosenecio, is a flowering plant native to Taiwan. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as mountain forests, and prefers well-drained soils. It has lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
